author: cryptopetz
title: Eth Gas to Fuel the ADA Fire
description: New and established ETH projects have felt the pain of gas costs and a saturated marketplace when launching a new project on Ethereum.

f6_assessments.q0: Hunting for projects that were going to launch on ETH is a GREAT strategic play connected to the spirit of this mission brief.  Er, wow.  MintCity's project still seems to have something of substance to offer, even to a person who doesn't care about NFT projects.
f6_assessments.q1:
Listed team has a good range of experience levels and a pretty clear high-level plan.  The chosen metrics look very good as well, reflecting forethought that is HIGHLY likely to influence the project's design in the direction of success.

When considering between 4 and 5 stars, I am considering the strength of the technical plan, which is not very clearly described.  I might take off a half-point for that, taken in isolation.  This is an improvement area for the proposers, and alone this wouldn't detract from a strong-agree rating.  

Not having identified any technical risk seems it could either be overconfidence or "they've already made strong progress and don't feel risk".  The budgets also seem very modest.  Their thoughtfully expressed strategy goes into the mix here too.  Taken together, these 4 factors make me think that this is an iteration (to "Website V2", as they say) that won't cost a great deal, that they can continue to iterate on - not much interesting that might be said about it.  

Tough call, but I'm falling on the side of this being highly likely a success!
f6_assessments.q2: Great metrics, a clear sense of going for objectives that are relevant and directly in service of the mission-brief.  Yes sir.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Mint City team has identified that NFT projects in Ethereum are struggling with the high gas costs and a saturated marketplace. They have created an easy-to-use solution that is especially attractive to some fairly new Ethereum-based projects who are past the initial change resistance. What the team fails to mention is that usually passionate artists and entrepreneurs don’t want to bother with anything extra: they just want to create (and get paid for it). I would say this is the actual challenge the team is solving: making things easy.

Just a glance at their website (https://mintcity.app/) is enough to convince me that these guys mean business! And they want to make the business easy for the creators. Right now the website is nothing but a front page with marketing talk. But as part of this proposal the team wishes to build a functioning Website through which automated project intake becomes possible. All in all, this proposal is exactly what is being asked in the challenge: a gateway to migrate.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a strong no-nonsense proposal developed by a highly capable team who have relevant experience and prior achievements. See, these guys are not at it the first time. Four of them already have a somewhat successful Cardano NFT project CryptoPetz in their resumés and Bart is a development reinforcement from the Netherlands. Although I haven’t been able to take a look “under the hood”, it seems the team is doing an exceptionally good job in making NFT minting easy and offering avenues for NFT distribution.

As a fan of the highly advanced RMRK NFT technology, I’m not saying CNFTs are the only solution for projects struggling in Ethereum, but the way Cardano is offered here as a gas-saving alternative is definitely tempting. I like the fact that they are offering consultation and go beyond art NFTs, addressing use cases in P2E gaming, exploring NFT utility and other concepts.

The budget is outlined clearly. Lion’s share of the budgeted amount is reserved for marketing costs. And it makes sense. The team has built a functioning set of solutions and has proven what it is capable of. Now it’s time to get this service off the ground. This Catalyst funding could give them the needed nudge for the coming months. Whether the business model is viable is yet to be seen. I would assume that right now a lot of their time goes to attracting new projects to use their service. Once the ball gets rolling, however, projects will start contacting them.

Two major risks have been identified: worries of value dilution when dealing with established projects and overall change resistance. The team has made a strategic choice to not focus too much on the established NFT ventures and they cater more to those who haven’t made it big yet. The change resistance is mitigated through educational one-on-one conversations with project leaders, aiming to inform them and alleviate any doubts they might have.
f6_assessments.q2:
The plans, timeline and budget are clear. The set goals are ambitious but realistic. As part of this proposal the team will finalize a more functional website, create consulting materials and onboard at least 24 projects. Their other metrics focus on quality, promising zero rug pulls, zero metadata mistakes/recalls and zero payment issues. The proposal states the goals for April-September 2022 although possible funding starts in May only. That shouldn’t be a big problem for the team, however, because they are already hard at work.

Tracking progress might be a little difficult, however. The team has not mentioned anything about reporting on progress before the website is ready, materials are created and the projects are onboarded. The latter, obviously, cannot be discussed in public before agreements are ready. That’s understandable. But it would be nice to have some mechanism for the Catalyst community to stay up-to-date on what the team is up to. Apart from this, it’s a pretty clear cut proposal that will surely bring in fantastic results.

See also their second proposal: https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/400473

f6_assessments.q0: There are currently NFT minting services on Cardano already available in the market, e.g NFT-Maker.io. They’ve already had a working product that this proposal is trying to make, that is to make minting NFT on Cardano as easy as possible. However, this proposal - namely Mint City - is not just creating another minting service, but also focusing on how to bring projects that are launching on Ethereum to switch over to Cardano. They do this through engaging and establishing a trusted relationship with the new and existing Ethereum projects, to demonstrate the capability of Cardano technology first hand. Mint City is specifically aligned to the challenge KPIs in every aspect by helping migrate NFT projects from Ethereum to Cardano. Ethereum NFT projects will later have an easy bridge to enable a shift to a more cost-effective and user-friendly ecosystem in Cardano. This proposal will bring more NFT projects to Cardano, hence will be able to scale in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal has provided their Mint City team profile, and we can verify their profile on LinkedIn. Their team consists of people that are working at Microsoft, to a seasoned Systems Engineer with relevant experience regarding Plutus development. They’ve also had their website running, however, it’s only a single landing page website and only a little information available, which is currently lacking considering their current objective. This proposal listed their services and feature that have been done, but I can’t seem to find what they’ve claimed easily on their website. There’s only one option to interact with the Mint City website, which is to contact them through email and it’s not seamless or convenient. NFT-Maker.io already has their website well structured and a great user experience when navigating through their website. Although they’ve mentioned that they’re working on the V2 website, it will be great if they also plan to revamp their UI/UX for a great user experience. This is important because Mint City target users are the people outside of Cardano and are on the Ethereum ecosystem, which already has a massive user-friendly ecosystem and platforms. My suggestion is to improve the user experience for the Mint City website so it can communicate to the user what are the feature and services you’re creating (take NFT-Maker.io for example for their UI/UX). Back to the proposal, the budgeting is well explained, although it could be better with breaking it down further, e.g What does consulting material does, what is it for? Is it another 3rd-party consulting firm? Then what does Business Development and Marketing Labor budget for? My point is, breaking down the budget details could give us evidence that the team knows what they’re doing and not just throwing money at people with experience, then hoping they could deliver to create the product because you paid them well. In terms of “will this project become a success”, I’m not convinced since they don’t have a clear timeline/roadmaps in detail. Overall, a great goal and objective, great team, but lack in detail about their roadmap and detailed plan, hence I will give it 2 star. It could be a 3-4 star if they’re able to explain about their plan and implementation in detail.
f6_assessments.q2: They didn’t provide a detailed roadmap and timeline. They do provide the metrics, however, it’s a metrics/goal within a span of 6 months. Explaining metrics/KPIs in detail with a clear timeline would be great, because every project will report their goal and milestone every other week or month in a call with IOG, to track the progress. They didn’t specify any Github or another publicly available platform for the community to check their progress, giving a Github repo link is the minimum for a technical proposal/project. Or, if it’s a private intellectual property, providing a social media hub is important too. Overall, it could be better with providing milestones and timelines in detail, and a portal to update the progress publicly. I will give it a 2 star for now.

f6_assessments.q0:
As the proponent mentioned, NFT-related projects on ETH are experiencing a distinct disadvantage in terms of transaction fees, saturation when releasing a new project, slow transaction speeds...
Therefore, providing an intuitive, user-friendly set of cNFT tools on cardano is essential.
In addition, the communication or airdrop of new projects today through ISPO is very supportive of the entire community. There are many projects calling for many billions of ADA to participate in staking.
This toolkit will include metadata creation, smart contract development, wallet integration website, sales transaction, automatic minting...
f6_assessments.q1:
This group of engineers has experience working at Microsoft and has participated in the Plutus pioneer programs. This is the basis to show that they have the experience to take on this project.
They have now deployed 2 projects on ETH that are being converted to. They also have a proposal for the features that will be available on the cNFT platform. The cost proposal is also very specific and quite reasonable.
Therefore, these are the bases to show the feasibility of the project if implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
The working group has about 24 projects available that have worked with them on ETH before. If there is guidance and support for these projects to migrate to Cardano, that is very positive.
Completion of this proposal will be from April to September 2022. (6 months)
They will compile data on the number of customers who are projects that convert from ETH to cardano. And the number of communities, the number of NFT transactions on these networks.
Currently they are in the research stage and complete ver1 of the product.
A small suggestion: you should have an official communication channel to report your work progress, or a report management software, or an open source page so that the community can see the progress and results. work.

f6_assessments.q0:
I am very satisfied with your idea “Eth Gas to Fuel the ADA Fire”. The proposal points out that the gas fees for setting up and trading on Ethereum are very high, which hinders projects from developing on it and linking with other blockchain platforms. The author outlines the advantage of Cardano for connecting with trusted projects on Ethereum. The solutions given are very logical and explained in detail, clearly and convincingly to the readers.
Solution: About Technology is designing a web3 service based on friendly interfaces from Web2, provides an intuitive full-service CNFT minting suite; About marketing: Through strong relationship building and demonstration of reduced cost and market saturation, promoting reliable projects and future development; About Consultative Approach consulting services for PFP, Play-to-Earn gaming, on-chain, and off-chain utility, and other NFT concept projects; Competitive Pricing: offer low-cost upfront pricing for those who prefer to pay before minting.
That's what I summed up in your solution. In my opinion, these are important explanatory details that focus on the core of the proposal's problem.
The project identifies appropriate KPIs such as the number of Eth projects transferred to Cardano, the number of pilot projects, the number of bridges established between the Eth and Cardano platforms. It is clear that the authors have identified the KPIs and challenges they need to achieve.
In the risky part of this proposal, the proponent mentioned being conservative among Ethereum boards before Cardano and outlined solutions for it.
Like Create one-on-one talks with key members of eth councils, talk about the dilution of supply in eth NFT projects. Besides, along with the transfer of large established projects from Ethereum to Cardano, emerging projects that have not yet developed are also promoted to the Cardano platform this time.
Those are very active and innovative solutions by the proponents that will greatly impact the Cardano ecosystem and enrich it, I support it.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project budget is divided into each work segment:
Develop and manage, advertise and market both clearly listed hardware and software. The author gives a figure of $ 1,800 for Resilient Azure Infrastructure: 6 months is reasonable, I have consulted Azure cloud and determined this.
A total project budget of $36,020 is completely acceptable. The project development team has a certain experience, the proponent offers 4 members with different job skills, the roles of 4 people in the proposal are also clearly described, the person in charge of the business development business, who is in charge of developing frontend and backend software. I found the project team capable enough to execute the technical part of this project, besides they also provided linked links to easily identify project members.
In this proposal work items are detailed, parts completed, parts in progress, and parts planned.
Unfortunately, this roadmap does not come with a specific time, so I do not know in what month or year the project will be completed or at what stage. This also makes it difficult to determine how long successful carpentry will be in the medium and long term. Update and assign project tasks with specific time to have a complete roadmap for your project.
f6_assessments.q2:
Proposals are tracked on metrics such as:
Total projects minted using Mint City; New projects that were previously considered launching on Ethereum; Existing Ethereum projects migrated to Cardano and Website automated project intake available.
In my opinion, in addition to the above sections, you should provide management tools for the project development process. such as Gran chart, agile process, or current software development management processes, it will help you control potential risks.
Or like tracking progress with GitHub links…
In this proposal, I see it very specifically in the "success for this project look like" section.
which is complete web version 2 version; Total projects minting with us: 24; Projects launching with us that were previously considered Ethereum: 12; Existing Ethereum projects migrated to Cardano via Mint City: 6; Projects that mint with us that sell out: 18.
The parameters are very specific and easy to measure, I think this is an advantage that many projects in this section often talk about in general inconsistently.
I acknowledge your merits and support this proposal to be developed. Hope you will bring many bridge projects from the Ethereum side to Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to contact and establish relationship with ETH projects to to convince them to shift from Ethereum and mint their projects on Cardano Mint City – a full service CNFT minting suite platform that is already existed. I can say the idea is truly great. The proposal is not only within the challenge, but also big valueable to the Cardano ecosystem, because once it’s successful, it will help increasing the number of projects that migrate from Ethereum and the number of users of these smart contracts once migrated to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The author provide link of the Mint City which is running, and explain what we already have in a very good level of information, allow us to understand about the platform, that is the strongest evidence to demonstrate the project is in expert hands. The team who makes up the project is also described about their names, professional majors, linkedin links and their skills and experience related to the conducting of the project. Moreover, the author mentions that the team has been able to convince two projects to shift from Ethereum, that certainly raises the trust from readers in the successful implementation of the project. The plan is explained clearly understandable about what is completed, what is in progress, and what is planned to do. Regarding to the financial amount, we can see it is broken down reasonably well into identifiable items, consist of development and management of front-end, back-end, and minting technology, marketing and advertising, and hardware and software. About the challenges/risks of executing the project, the authot explains them very well, as well as the solutions/ mitigation, helps us understand more about the project. However, due to the budget breadown we can see the project is planned in 6 months, I think it would be more benificial if we also have timetable in the plan to see what will be done each month (or each of two months…). It is just my bonus idea for the project greater, I strongly agree the proposal is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: This part of proposal is written very well about what we need to audit the proposal. We can monitor the progress based on the detailed plan and KPIs. Especially, the part of “What does success for this project look like” gives us specific numbers as expected to measure, and all of them will be shown in the website, so that the proposal is fully auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses migrating NFT projects from Ethereum onto Cardano. The team say they do this with "Vending Machine Technology" and their wallet link technology (no references). The project IMO aligns with the challenge in terms of project migrations.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal say that they "now have an easy bridge"  (from Ethereum to Cardano) but dont really give any information what this means. They have a a backend/Plutus Dev, Jack, but i cant see a Solidity dev anywhere.. so when they talk about migration of a project, its seems to me like Mint city is more about convincing projects to simply start on Cardano. They do have a list of deliverables but i cant see dates or timeline.
f6_assessments.q2: I think here the auditabiliy is lacking slightly. They do have a list of things that need to get done, but i cant see a clearly structured project time line.  How can the community measure that the project is on track and how can the project team measure the product and communicate this to the community once done? -- i dont see this mentioned other than "total projects minting with us"

f6_assessments.q0: MintCity is a proposal looking to create an application for making it easy to mint NFT projects on Cardano with a number of features such as whitelists, airdrops and royalties among others. The proposal team suggest that their application will help with persuading Ethereum projects to migrate. The application itself is a new product being developed by the team which then does not align with the challenge brief. The team mention they have projects that are looking to migrate from ETH but do not mention who they are meaning no evidence is provided. This proposal would have been very well suited to the DApps & Integrations challenge as they are creating a new solution that both existing Cardano community could use and also potentially projects from other ecosystems. It would have also been useful to know what differences this proposal execution will have over existing NFT minting services such as https://www.nft-maker.io/ so the proposal team can showcase their understanding of the existing market.
f6_assessments.q1: A website and collection of LinkedIn profiles have been provided. The team is responsible for https://cryptopetz.io/. No Github repository was provided to showcase existing work and the teams skills regarding NFTs or smart contracts. A break down of the plan and budget have been provided in sufficient depth. There is enough sources and information provided to suggest this proposal is feasible. To achieve a better score more evidence would have been useful to provide more confidence regarding the teams ability to execute this proposal from a technical standpoint due to rich feature set they are suggesting.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal team look to track the total projects minted using Mint City, the new projects that were previously considering Ethereum that migrate and then any existing Ethereum projects that migrated to Cardano. The Ethereum related metrics are more difficult to prove as they will require the team to get all those answers from the projects they are interacting with. Although time consuming tracking these metrics are at least possible. They've detailed some minting targets for measuring success which seem reasonable. It would have been good to know if there was any way in which these target numbers were derived so that it is easier to determine if they are realistic and fair. It would have been good to see more information on what the team intends to open source if anything which would make both the work more auditable but also more useful for the community to learn from.

solution: Contact & establish a trusted relationship with new & existing ETH projects to demonstrate the capability of Cardano technology first hand.
experience: Our team is composed of Plutus Pioneers, developers, engineers, and Microsoft executives. With multiple successful CNFT, NFT & multi-chain project minting launches, Mint City is uniquely positioned to understand Ethereum minting pain points.
